title: Power ministry approves project worth ₹3,600 crore to upgrade power infra in Gurugram, Faridabad
description: On Wednesday, the power ministry approved ₹3,600 crore for updating the power distribution facilities in Gurugram and Faridabad under the Revamped Distribution Sector Scheme. The project includes 500 feeders, 20 new Gas Insulated Substations, and 3,500 km of underground cabling. Approximately 5,000 new distribution transformers will be installed, and the network will undergo significant automation for better fault detection and power restoration. These upgrades aim to improve safety, aesthetics, and overall infrastructure in both cities.
